intro: Ochthocosmus senensis f. latifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved variant of the Senese ochthocosmus, is a unique horticultural form of a rare shrub native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its broader, more substantial leaves compared to the typical form, which contributes to its ornamental appeal. The plant typically grows in tropical or subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil with partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is often a deep green, and it may produce small, inconspicuous flowers under favorable conditions. Due to its rarity and specific care requirements, it is a sought-after plant among botanical enthusiasts and collectors.
